## Using git

git is a command line version control system. We can use it from R studio (via the "git pane" in the top right) or from the terminal (via the "terminal pane" in the bottom left).




use 
git add .
to automatically add everything in git
let's try!


The steps to use git involve:

- Initiate a git repository
  git init
  or click the little box in Rstudio
  
  
- Do your work (same as ever)
  add files
  edit files
  save files
  
  
- **Add files you care about to the "stage"**
  git add <file name>
  or
  git add .
  
  
- **Commit your changes**
  git commit -m "a message describing the changes you made"
  click "commit" in Rstudio
